title: Coronation Street spoilers: David prepares to stab rapist Josh?
text:
The prison sentence which David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) is currently serving in Coronation Street just got a whole lot harder, as — after paying a visit to the medical wing in tonight’s episode — he came face-to-face with the man who raped him last year, Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton).

David’s not been having the best time as of late, as — due to him being stuck in prison — he’s unable to do anything about Max’s odd behaviour — something which Shona’s (Julia Goulding) been struggling greatly with. Tonight, his problems got worse when he learned that Max is not only staying at his grandmother Marion’s house, but that Marion is also planning on applying for custody of her grandson.

With a tense and uncomfortable atmosphere growing at the prison, David wasn’t in the best place — but things got much worse when he headed down to the medical bay for his medication. While there, he was confronted with a face from his past, as he spotted a battered and bruised Josh awaiting medical treatment.

David was understandably left shaken, and after making eye-contact with Josh for only a moment, he headed off back to his cell.

Abe later confirmed to David that the reason Josh is in prison is because he drugged and raped someone, which led David to admit that he did exactly the same to him last year.

However, Abe then informed David that a riot is planned for the following day, before revealing how such an event would make for the perfect opportunity to get revenge on Josh for what he did to David.

David wasn’t too sure about the whole thing, but Abe revealed that he’d be able to get his hands on a weapon which he could then use to kill his rapist.

Will David take part in the riot?

What’s more, will he carry out revenge on Josh?

Coronation Street continues on Monday 21st October at 7:30pm on ITV.
